entry.title: Add skip_base_tests support to generated js tests
entry.content:
test.any.js shows up on the filesystem as one file but becomes

two tests: test.any.html and test.any.worker.html. For more info, see:

https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testharness.html. This

patch adds support for skipping the base tests when adding "test.any.js"

to skip_base_tests. Prior to this patch, the base version of these

tests would continue to run.



Change-Id: I9411bd389cd90dcae41b32d4cfe928c58067281d

entry.title: Move servable_ etc. to PrefetchResponseReader
entry.content:
This CL further moves members needed for serving

from `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` to

`PrefetchResponseReader`, as preparation to make

PrefetchContainer servable multiple times as long as

`PrefetchResponseReader` is alive.



This CL slightly changes the ordering

between setting `head_` and calling

`on_prefetch_response_started_callback_`

in `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader::OnReceiveResponse()`,

but this shouldn't affect the behavior because

the dependency between those two were removed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4671133.



Bug: 1449360

entry.title: Add more debug logging for content analysis print browser test failure
entry.content:
Aborting out of PrintAfterPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded() on a renderer

failure can result in the test exiting out of the waiting loop early.

This can trigger various different other checks in printing, depending

upon how far along the asynchronous steps have gotten for the

particular test.



It has been seen that in some cases the renderer terminating is

actually not a problem, as all necessary printing callbacks happened

before the ExecJs() returned. This was only previously seen on Linux

though.



This change is to help further debug the issue. By allowing a test to

continue in PrintAfterPreviewIsReadyAndLoaded() even if ExecJs() fails

will alter the signature of crashes. This will help to determine if

flaky behavior is due to a problem happening in the renderer vs. just

from an ASSERT_TRUE() check that is too strict.



Bug: 1472464

Change-Id: Ic45af4a0d8497341e81b3f1ec2f1c842f7b55eb3

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Specify radius of HeaderView through a setter
entry.content:
This CL changes how we set the radius of HeaderView. Instead of

HeaderView getting the radius internally, we now specify the radius

through a setter. We also remove the logic of updating header radius

based on the change in state of its target window from HeaderView.



This allows NonClientFrameViews that use HeaderView to specify

radius rather than having a default radius for HeaderView.



This CL builds on top of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684253,

where we moved setting the radius outside of DefaultFrameHeader and

BrowserFrameHeaderChromeOS.



Also got rid creating objects using new keyword and made view

ownership cleaner in NonClientFrameViewAsh.



Bug: 1415486, b:287060338

entry.title: [Empty States] Make empty view scrollable
entry.content:
- Wrap empty view in a ScrollView to make it scrollable.

- Add top and bottom margin to tab switcher empty view to ensure the view does scroll up to toolbar and its's centered.



- In download, use onConfigurationChangedCallback to add different margin depends on screen orientation(landscape vs. portrait).

- Apply DownloadStorageSummaryHeight in top margin to ensure the empty view does not scroll up to download_storage_summary.

- Apply bottom margin only when windowHeight is bigger than the maxEmptyViewHeight, because otherwise the screen will not have enough space for bottom margin and text will get cut off.



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/14TeB6eW0RMoZQu7LbtgAh-UcEzfx0vOc/view?usp=sharing



Before(apply same margin regardless screen orientation):

- Apply top margin less than DownloadStorageSummaryHeight will cause the empty view to move above download_storage_summary. This becomes worse in ScrollView:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/87Z7EMaZNQMfFDh

- Apply DownloadStorageSummaryHeight in top margin and (DownloadStorageSummaryHeight + SelectableListToolbarHeight / 2) in bottom margin would take too much bottom space and text gets cut off: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/48PpLXtQRGK8JUP

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix timing issue with idb factory requests
entry.content:
When the permission state was not cached locally, multiple `open`

calls might have resulted in multiple requests to the settings

client. Multiple requests are not necessary and could even cause

the requests to be executed out of order. Consider the case where

two requests are created and referred to the settings client; the

first request comes back and updates the locally cached state (i.e.

`allowed_`). Then if a third request is created and shortcuts the

settings client due to `allowed_` being set, it executes ahead

of the second request which is still making its way through the

settings client.



This issue is addressed by creating a unified backlog of requests

which is cleared when `allowed_` is resolved, rather than multiple

calls into the settings client.



Practically speaking, I don't expect many sites to have run into

this issue because the execution order of 3 consecutive calls to

`open` probably won't matter very often.



Bug: none

Change-Id: I3492589bd33e07744f45a3bdf5f52228bce58473

Commit-Queue: Evan Stade

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Remove scoring signals for history fuzzy provider matches.
entry.content:
The fuzzy provider works by running the bookmark and history quick

providers with a "corrected" input and applying a penalty proportional

to the correction amount to the results. The scoring signals are

populated according to the correct input and leads to an artificially

inflated model output.



We previously attempted to correct for this by re-applying the penalty

after re-scoring. This was not sufficient in demoting the fuzzy

suggestions.



This CL attempts to correct for this by clearing the

scoring signals in the fuzzy provider, as these are not accurate for

the actual input, resulting in fuzzy matches no longer being re-scored

by the model.



Bug: 1472374, 1405555

entry.title: [Nearby][QuickStart] Allow signin profile for Nearby Connections.
entry.content:
This allows the NearbyDependenciesProvider and NearbyProcessManager to

be created for the signin profile for use with Quick Start. We ensure

that these dependencies are only created for the OTR signin profile and

the regular user profile. This also updates the profile checks in the

Nearby Share and Phone Hub services accordingly.



The "signin profile" is used for rendering the OOBE UI among other

responsibilities. An important note is that this profile is never

destroyed, even after user login. This is because it is occasionally

used to render certain system UIs, exchange data between profiles, etc.



When the parent CL lands it will ensure that Nearby Connections is not

launched by Quick Start unless the user engages with the feature. This

makes it safe to create these services for the signin profile. The

NearbyDependenciesProfider and NearbyProcessManager tied to the signin

profile will not perform any work.



A follow-up CL will ensure that we shut down Nearby Connections at the

end of the Quick Start flow so that we never have multiple instances of

the utility process running when the user session begins.



Design doc:

go/cros-quick-start-nc



More info on profile types:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/chrome/browser/profiles/profile_keyed_service_factory.md



https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile_selections.h



Test: Regression tested on DUT.

entry.title: [send-tab-to-self] Make GetEntryPointDisplayReason() a method
entry.content:
No behavior change.

Before this CL there was a GetEntryPointDisplayReason(...) free

function taking a bunch of services as parameters, including the

send-tab-to-self keyed service (SendTabToSelfSyncService).

Add SendTabToSelfSyncService::GetEntryPointDisplayReason(const GURL&)

and migrate callers.

Advantages:

- Easier testing, we can fake one service (SendTabToSelfSyncService)

instead of many.

- Hides dependencies. I might add a new service dependency soon, I

don't want to update every caller each time I do so.



The free function still exists, moved to an "internal" namespace, and

is called by SendTabToSelfSyncService. I would prefer to inline the

logic in SendTabToSelfSyncService and unit test that class, but this

requires moving the construction of some fields to the parent and it

looked weird for one particular WeakPtr. So I decided against.



For next CLs we could consider removing "Sync" from the name of the

service. Its API isn't tied to sync before this CL and now even less

so.

entry.title: [reland] weblayer: sets webview_includes_weblayer to false
entry.content:
This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4759226/

It was reverted because of dependencies in another repo. Those

dependencies have been fixed, so this should be able to land. This

is exactly the same as the original patch, no other changes have

been done.



I'm in the process of removing weblayer. The bots are no longer

building any of the tests, but because webview binary includes

weblayer, the code is still built. This sets

webview_includes_weblayer to false so that weblayer is no longer

built.



Setting webview_includes_weblayer to false exposes some other

random build issues, which are fixed here as well.



Also, as webview no longer includes weblayer I also had to update

binary expectation files.



Bug: 1471446

entry.title: Fix soft nav LCP text candidate update for 1st soft navigation
entry.content:
Some initial colab analysis on soft nav LCP found that the total soft

nav count is significantly larger than total soft nav LCP count.



We found that when the 1st soft navigation happens, the text candidate

might not be updated properly and hence the soft nav LCP not recorded.

This might be one cause of the soft nav count being larger than soft nav

LCP count.

See details at the investigation doc linked in the bug.



This CL is to fix this update issue by

1, Fix the ContentfulPaintTimingInfo::Empty() method so it can exclude

invalid LCP candidates on the browser side.

2, Make text candidate update properly in PaintTimingDetector when 1st

soft nav happens.



Bug: 1472878

Change-Id: I6e17964c4ddee8db25411d30a511ef400603a9d3

entry.title: Skip fragment item pre-allocation inside block fragmentation.
entry.content:
When in block fragmentation (and the fragmentainer size is known), we'd

greatly over-estimate the number of fragment items to be added to the

builder.



This lead to an out-of-memory situation, presumably because oilpan

didn't get around to collecting all the large temporary buffers before

it was too late (at least one such buffer would be allocated per

fragmentainer).



The test included is just a perf test, which is about 3.5 times faster

than before. Writing a test that would crash without this fix would be

super-slow also with the fix included, so this is the best we can do, as

far as I can tell.



Bug: 1471849

Change-Id: I3c1c2757349da9508657984b7d371f9243f5809b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4782829

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1184376}

entry.title: Add RenderProcessHostObserver::InProcessRendererExiting
entry.content:
This new notification is useful for worker code that needs to observe

the render process exiting, which doesn't work in --single-process

mode.



Used in this CL to fix an issue where 2 RenderProcessHostObservers

were watching for the RenderProcessHostDestroyed() notification to

clean up nodes on the performance manager graph, but one of the

observer needed to be notified first, which depended on the somewhat

random order of the observers in the observer list.

entry.title: Reland "[gardener] Revert "Fix days until expiration calculation for DST""
entry.content:
This reverts commit b2de40eb997a6f8af3372d3f1ba4ed9643750339.



Reason for revert: Failure on Android ARM continuous tests

Owners-Override: true



Original change's description:

> Revert "[gardener] Revert "Fix days until expiration calculation for DST""

>

> This reverts commit 9265431c5d16fb7df45169e9ac06221cade3a51f.

>

> Reason for revert: Fixed a bug in release builds.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [gardener] Revert "Fix days until expiration calculation for DST"

> >

> > This reverts commit 90670c1a71800fcb6e1d48e9b2a94e99106b80d1.

> >

> > Reason for revert: CookieControlsUtilTests (new and existing) fail consistently on Mac and Cast Audio Linux, see crbug/1473017.

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Fix days until expiration calculation for DST

> > >

> > > When crossing a transition into and out of DST the days to expiration

> > > calculation was previously incorrect because it was calculating days in

> > > UTC.

> > >

> > > Bug: 1446230

> > > Change-Id: I190508d395d7ab89d17ac7b385ce007c4ff24360

> > > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4777178

> > > Reviewed-by: Mariam Ali

> > > Commit-Queue: Kevin Graney

> > > Reviewed-by: Christian Dullweber

> > > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1183576}

> >

> > Bug: 1446230, 1473017

> > Change-Id: Ia92fb4e6be0e4202e146feff0692015a932b21fe

> > No-Presubmit: true

entry.title: Deflake tests interacting with `CreateChromeApplicationShortcut` dialog.
entry.content:
This CL modifies all tests that interact with the

`CreateChromeApplicationShortcut` dialog. Affected tests:



* `AppHomePageHandlerTest.CreateWebAppShortcut`

* `AppHomePageHandlerTest.CreateExtensionAppShortcut`

* Various test cases in the `WebAppIntegration` test suite



Before this CL, the tests would use

`views::NamedWidgetShownWaiter::WaitIfNeededAndGet` and then immediately

call `views::test::AcceptDialog`. This behavior could fail the

`DCHECK(IsDialogButtonEnabled(ui::DIALOG_BUTTON_OK))` in

`DialogDelegate::AcceptDialog`, because

`CreateChromeApplicationShortcutView::IsDialogButtonEnabled` can return

`false` in a time window between 1) constructing+showing the dialog and

2) the time when `CreateChromeApplicationShortcutView::OnAppInfoLoaded`

gets called.



After this CL, a helper method is used to not only wait for the dialog

to be shown, but to also wait until its "ok" button is enabled.



Bug: 1471546

entry.title: [iOS] Don't delete the preferred language setting on startup
entry.content:
Starting in iOS 13, iOS lets users choose a preferred language for

each app, possibly different from their system language, in the

Settings app. This value is stored in NSUserDefaults, in an

"AppleLanguages" key.



Prior to iOS 13, there was no supported way to make an app's language

different from the system language, so Chrome had an Experimental

Setting whose value, if set, was used to overwrite the value of

"AppleLanguages" in NSUserDefaults, and if unset, caused

"AppleLanguages" to get cleared, resetting its effective value to

the system language.



However, this means that setting the preferred language through the

iOS-provided UI has been broken ever since this UI was added in iOS

13, since "AppleLanguages" gets deleted on startup when Chrome's

experimental setting has a default value, which it will always have

in Stable builds (which don't have experimental settings).



Since there is an iOS-supported way to set Chrome's language,

there's no longer a need for the Experimental setting, particularly

given that the Experimental setting breaks the iOS-supported

approach.



This CL removes the Experimental setting and its associated logic.



Bug: 1472278

entry.title: Revert "Dawn: Add DawnImageRepresentationFallback."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5ff653233b7614c960f56c0216a987dec21c4079.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8772576133810484993



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8772576133810484993



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8772576133810484993&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4759704



Original change's description:

> Dawn: Add DawnImageRepresentationFallback.

>

> To support sharing IOSurface backed SI with Dawn's Vulkan/SwiftShader

> backend. Currently this DawnImageRepresentationFallback

> is implemented by CPU readbacks/uploads.

>

> In theory this class could be used by any backing not natively supported

> by Vulkan/SwiftSahder in future. Such as D3DImageBacking. As long as

> those backings implement UploadFromMemory & ReadbackToMemory methods.

>

entry.title: [Extensions] Avoid cast in ExtensionsBrowserClient::IsValidContext
entry.content:
ExtensionsBrowserClient::IsValidContext() has a static_cast from a

content::BrowserContext to a Profile object. However, if the object is

*not* a valid context (profile), this static cast is unsafe and can

cause clang to crash with an illegal operation exception.



Remove the static_cast'ing in these methods and also update them to take

in `void*`s rather than `content::BrowserContext*`s. This is inline with

the method they effectively map to (ProfileManager::IsValidProfile())

and also guarantees that the implementations don't use the values passed

on the chance they are invalid.



Note that there are more robust fixes for this issue that are being

investigated as part of a larger refactor, but this should fix the

immediate crash.



Bug: 1470579

Change-Id: I446a8e4ebd0289c96126abb5cd9775ef20b31c23

entry.title: snap-group: Replace map and set in window cycle view
entry.content:
This cl removes `window_view_map_` and `no_previews_set_` in window

cycle view. As snap group will have two windows points to the same

container view in the subsequent implementation, it will lead to

serious caveat on window destroying. The container view will be

removed twice, the 2nd time will be dangling pointer.

By replacing the map and set with two concrete lists, this issue

can be eliminated as we will no longer have many to one relationship.

entry.title: Add feature flag kDiscardInputEventsToRecentlyMovedFrames
entry.content:
When enabled, this features expands an existing browser intervention: if

an input event targeting a cross-origin iframe arrives very soon after

the iframe has moved in the parent document; and if the iframe is using

IntersectionObserver V2 features; then the event will be silently

ignored. The new feature flag expands this intervention by dropping the

IntersectionObserver V2 requirement.



It also adds a UseCounter to attempt to estimate how often we make a

mistake in discarding an event (i.e, we discard an event even though the

user actually intends to click on the recently-moved iframe). If a

"down" event is discarded, and another "down" event with the same target

arrives within five seconds, then we assume that the first event was

intentional.



Bug: 1366425

Change-Id: I5601204a1d93bf184ac527ac2161dec91a2ec084

entry.title: Fully ship EarlyProcessSingleton experiment
entry.content:
This CL is shipping by default the early process singleton

experiment.



Previously, the process singleton was taken after the

creation of the BrowserProcessImpl and was not covering all the

accesses to Chrome user-data-dir (a.k.a prefs).



The new early implementation is lifting the scope of the singleton

into ChromeMainDelegate class. This is simplifying the logic around

what is covered by the singleton.



There will be no BrowserProcessImpl(...) unless the process own the

singleton.

entry.title: gpu: Refactor load program binary shm flag
entry.content:
This is a refactor that does not intend to change behavior, but prepares

for fixing logic for deleting shader cache if shader loading fails.



Motivation is making ActivityFlags since there can be multiple GPU

threads that load shaders now. ActivityFlags has only ever had one

flag since its inception years ago. So just remove the support for

multiple flags and just turn it into a count that's incremented

atomically. Switch to using std::atomic since base::subtle::Atomics

is deprecated.



Rename everything from "activity flags" to "use shader cache shm

count".



Bug: 1470074

entry.title: Migrate ChromeExtensionTestNotificationObserver off of Notification Service
entry.content:
Note these intentional changes:

1. Since NotificationSet is essentially polling for a change in the

result of the predicate passed to it instead of waiting for a

specific event, we don't bother having callers specify which notifications to check the predicate on.

2. Observing render process termination appears to be redundant with

OnExtensionFrameUnregistered for the purposes of this class, so we

no longer explicitly observe the former.

3. It does not appear necessary to observe all sources, so we now

only observe any existing extension related WebContents at the

creation of the observer and then any WebContents created afterwards.



Bug: 1174764, 357627

entry.title: Move a JsReplace() call to StringPrintf()
entry.content:
Unfortunately, JsReplace() only supports placeholders $1 to $9, and

crrev.com/c/4744259 would need to use $10 and $11.



The syntax for base::StringPrintf() isn't as readable or concise, and it

doesn't escape strings for JavaScript [0], but it does support an

unlimited number of %s placeholders.



To avoid needing to repeatedly pass parameters that are used more than

once, these are stored in JavaScript constants to allow reuse.



This CL doesn't move all usages of JsReplace() to StringPrintf(), or

even those near them limit (using placeholder $9) -- those can be

migrated when the need arises.



[0] That said, we're not using any invalid characters like " in our

strings currently, so explicitly calling an escape function shouldn't be

necessary, for now.



Change-Id: Iec1191bc3b4f50472a177539470a0839c6784ede

entry.title: Cached callbacks in PersistedTabDataAndroid
entry.content:
By caching callbacks we avoid a potential bug which might occur

when multiple requests are being handled simultaneously. The

second callback can potentially overwrite a change made

after the first callback returns.

entry.title: Added SystemNudgePauseManager to support system nudge pause
entry.content:
This CL added a SystemNudgePauseManager to manage all

SystemNudgeController so that we could add a ScopedNudgePause to

suppress them. SystemNudgePauseManager has a static getter to get the

singleton. When a ScopedNudgePause is constructed, the manager will

suppress all the system nudges immediately until ScopedNudgePause is

destroyed. Unittests are added in SystemNudgeTest.

entry.title: Fenced frames: add browser-side focus verification.
entry.content:
Fenced frames have checks to make sure that focus cannot be pulled

programmatically across a fenced frame boundary. However, because of how

user activation works, all of the gating happens on the renderer side.

This is problematic because this allows a compromised renderer to pull

focus across a fenced frame boundary as much as it wants, which can be

used to open a communication channel.



This CL adds checks on the browser side to make sure that any renderer

that pulls focus across a fenced frame boundary was allowed to do so.

This handles every focus case, including tab traversals, clicking to

focus, programmatic focus, and accessibility-based focusing. If the

browser determines focus was not allowed, the plan is to consider the

renderer compromised and kill it. Right now, until we know for sure that

there are no false positives with this check, we will instead call

DumpWithoutCrashing() to be able to monitor this.



Note that the focus check will bad message the renderer in tests, CQ,

and ToT builds.



This CL introduces a new transient state tracking mechanism that will

track if a RFHI passing focus had transient user activation. As focus is

moved from one RFHI to the next (through the

RenderFrameProxyHost::AdvanceFocus and RenderFrameHostImpl::TakeFocus

calls), the transient user activation status will be passed with the

focus change.



A new transient state tracking mechanism is added to

RenderWidgetHostImpl to track if focus was lost between calls to

RenderFrameHostImpl::DidFocusFrame(). This is done in order to detect if

focus was moved from a page to a UI element (such as the navbar). This

is needed because focus moving from a UI element back to the page could

be considered a bad focus otherwise.



The logic that consumes user activation when crossing a fenced frame

boundary is moved from the renderer to the browser as part of this

change, since focus verification needs to complete before user

activation can be consumed.



Examples:



MainFrame(FF1):

- If the main frame currently has focus and we click on FF1, the focus

checks will succeed simply because the click action gave the fenced

frame user activation.

- If instead we focus from MainFrame to FF1, the focus transfer

into FF1 will succeed specifically because gives MainFrame user

activation (which allows it to transfer focus). FF1 script will observe

the focus transfer into it, but user activation will not come with it.

- If we move focus from FF1 to another element in FF1, focus will be

allowed because the change in focus does not cross into a fenced frame

boundary.

- If a compromised renderer tries to move focus from MainFrame to FF1

without user gesture, since there is no user gesture on either frames,

and since focus is crossing a fenced frame boundary, the browser will

reject the focus change and badmessage the renderer. Note that this CL

will only badmessage the renderer in tests, CQ, and ToT builds. All

other builds will instead call DumpWithoutCrashing() so we can monitor

potential missed corner cases.



MainFrame(FF1(FF2),FF3) with a focusable element only in MainFrame and

FF3:

- If we focus through the focusable elements, we will first focus

on the element in MainFrame. Focus is allowed because it is not crossing

a fenced frame boundary into a fenced frame. The MainFrame will also get

transient user activation as a result of this action. We then wait for

MainFrame's transient user activation to expire before performing the

next step.

- The next gets more complicated. MainFrame will get transient

user activation, and then (1) activate FF1's transient state, (2)

deactivate MainFrame's transient state, and (3) pass focus into FF1.

This passing of focus into FF1 is allowed because the transient state

has been activated as a part of the user-gesture-initiated focus from

MainFrame => FF1. However, there are no focusable elements in FF1 so,

through RenderFrameProxyHost::AdvanceFocus(), FF1 will (1) activate

FF2's transient state, (2) deactivate FF1's transient state, and (3)

pass focus to FF2.

- Focus is allowed in FF2 due to the transient state, but FF2 still

needs to pass focus to the next frame. Through

RenderFrameHostImpl::TakeFocus(), FF2 will (1) activate FF1's transient

state, (2) deactivate FF2's transient state, and (3) pass focus back up

to FF1. FF1 will perform the same actions with MainFrame, which in turn

will perform the same actions with FF3 through

RenderFrameProxyHost::AdvanceFocus().

- FF3 has an element it can focus, so FF3 will focus that element, and

the focus check will pass because its transient state is activated.



MainFrame(FF1(FF2),FF3) with a focusable element only in FF3:

- If we press for the first time, MainFrame will get user

activation as we start the same traversal process as outlined in the

previous example. We will end up with the element in FF3 getting focus.

- If we press again, focus will leave the RenderWidgetHost and go

into the UI. RenderWidgetHostImpl::LostFocus() will be called and it

will set `has_lost_focus_` to true.

- Pressing one more time will start the traversal process again.

However, this time, no frames will have user activation. Instead,

MainFrame will see that `has_lost_focus_` is true, and will activate its

transient state tracking mechanism due to that. It will then go through

the same traversal process, where this time the transient state tracking

mechanism will be active due to the RWH losing focus rather than the

focus originator having user activation.



See design document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DH9l2mQJbPBJkSEkyVQPpswLafEwSPvKybMJRfgNuhA/edit?usp=sharing



Change-Id: I4c771ac56605f204ef3facb501115ff8ce01b428

entry.title: sql: Consider poisoned databases closed
entry.content:
This feature is enabled by default, but is gated behind a new base

feature flag. It builds on the changes behind the kClearDbIfCloseFails

flag. Rather than adding a new flag whose value would depend on this

older flag, this CL simply removes the older flag, which has been on

stable for almost two milestones and is therefore removable according

to the flag-guarding guidelines.

entry.title: libsupersize: delete fake metadata files from testdata
entry.content:
Using a real metadata file (in this case //sandbox/COMMON_METADATA)

tricks other tooling into believing this testdata is actually owned by

the sandboxing team. These files seem not to be used by anything, so

just delete them.
